cards.title: The Mistress Of Fate
setup: At the start of the game, {TheMistressOfFate} enters play “Endless Cycle“ side up.
Put the Timeline card in the center of the play area. Shuffle the day cards face down, and place them in a row to the right of the Timeline.
gameplay: At the start of the villain turn, flip the left-most face down day card.
{TheMistressOfFate} is immune to villain damage. If there are no cards in the villain deck, the heroes lose.

Continue playing if all heroes are incapacitated. Incapacitated heroes keep the cards from their hand, deck, and trash separate from each other when removing them from the game. Cards that were in play go to their trash.
cards.advanced: At the end of the villain turn, {TheMistressOfFate} deals the hero with the lowest HP {H} psychic damage.
flippedGameplay: Continue playing if all heroes are incapacitated.
* Restore all other targets to their maximum HP.
* Flip all day cards face down.
* Remove all cards in the villain trash and the{BR}  top {H - 1} cards of the villain deck from the{BR}  game without looking at them.

* Flip all incapacitated heroes and restore them to their{BR}  maximum HP. Cards that were in a hero's deck, hand,{BR}  or trash when they were incapacitated are returned{BR}  to those respective locations.
cards.flippedAdvanced: When {TheMistressOfFate} flips to this side, she regains 10 HP.
cards.challengeText: When {TheMistressOfFate} flips to her “Back to the Beginning side”, immediately discard the top card of the villain deck for each face-down Day card.

openingLines.default: Within this twisted time, my rulership is absolute. Struggle if you wish to. It won't matter.
openingLines.Cauldron.BaccaratCharacter: Return that which you stole from me! You will not cheat Fate a second time.
openingLines.AceOfSorrowsBaccaratCharacter: I will leave you trapped in time for all eternity!
openingLines.AceOfSwordsBaccaratCharacter: You cannot defeat me with my own Deck of Fate. Soon not even your memory will remain.
openingLines.PastBaccaratCharacter: Saints and Sinners, Swords and Sorrows: none of these things can save you from Fate.
openingLines.PastTangoOneCharacter: There is no escape. I have closed off time itself from you. No matter where you run, here is where you will end up.
openingLines.PastTheStrangerCharacter: Give in, and you can stay here, in this form, forever.
openingLines.PastNecroCharacter: I have seen your path through time. Give in, and take my place in this loop. You will only suffer if you do not.
openingLines.PastVanishCharacter: Ah, the traveler. I appreciate the anomaly you created for me.
openingLines.PastMagnificentMaraCharacter: False magician. You will stay trapped here forever, as revenge for what was done to me.
openingLines.PastTheKnightCharacter: Old knight, already lost in time. Now you are mine!
openingLines.DualDriftCharacter: What impudence! I am trapped in this speck of history, and you flit about it at will? I will crush the very memory of you!

cards.title: Can't Fight Fate
body: The hero with the highest HP may discard 3 cards that share a keyword.
If they do not, {TheMistressOfFate} deals each target in that hero's play area 20 psychic damage.

flavorQuotes.text: You always have something to lose.

cards.flavorReference: The Mistress of Fate, The Debt #1

cards.title: Chaos Butterfly
body: At the end of the villain turn, this card deals each hero target 3 projectile damage and 3 cold damage.
When this card is destroyed, the players may swap the position of 2 face up Day cards. Cards under them move as well.

cards.title: Fading Realities
body: The hero with the second lowest HP may select 1 card in their hand and 1 of their cards in play. Remove the selected cards from the game.
If 2 cards were not removed from the game this way, {TheMistressOfFate} deals that hero 20 infernal damage.

flavorQuotes.text: I will not remain trapped in this{BR}decaying moment of time. Not alone.

cards.flavorReference: The Mistress of Fate, Adrift One-shot

cards.title: Hour Devourer
body: At the end of the villain turn, this card deals each non-villain target X sonic damage, where X is 3 times the number of Day cards face up.
When damage dealt by a target destroys this card, that target becomes immune to damage until the start of its next turn.

cards.title: Illusion of Free Will
body: Play this card next to the hero with the lowest HP. Destroy this card if {TheMistressOfFate} flips or there are ever less than 5 cards in the villain deck.
Redirect damage dealt by this hero’s cards to the hero with the highest HP. At the end of this hero's turn, play the top 2 cards of their deck.

flavorQuotes.text: You assume this to be a{BR}matter of choice. But your{BR}destiny is already written.

cards.flavorReference: The Mistress of Fate, Adrift One-shot

cards.title: Memory of Tomorrow
body: When this card enters play, move it next to the right-most face up Day card and {TheMistressOfFate} deals each hero 5 sonic damage and 5 cold damage.
Each time the Day card next to this one is flipped face up, 1 hero may draw a card and play a card.
cards.flavorReference: Tango One, Once More With Feeling

cards.title: Necessary Correction
body: When this card enters play, {TheMistressOfFate} deals the {H - 1} hero targets with the highest HP 10 psychic damage each.
At the end of the environment turn, if there are at least 5 cards remaining in the villain deck, destroy this card and {TheMistressOfFate} flips.

flavorQuotes.text: Your little jaunt{BR}through her timeline gave her an{BR}anomaly to work with. She doesn't need{BR}those magic cards any more.

cards.title: Residual Malus
body: The first time a hero card is played each turn, this card deals that hero X melee damage, where X is the number of cards in the environment trash plus 1.
When this card is destroyed, destroy 1 Warped Malus.

flavorQuotes.text: No one lasts beyond{BR}their time without consequence.

cards.flavorReference: The Mistress of Fate, Abstract Tales Annual #4

cards.title: Same Time and Place
body: When this card enters play, {TheMistressOfFate} deals each hero 10 melee damage.

If there is no card beneath this one and an environment card leaves play, put that card beneath this one. When a Day card flips face down, put any cards beneath this one on top of the environment deck.

flavorQuotes.text: How come we always reset here? I{BR}don't like any of their foods.

cards.title: See the Pattern
body: When this card enters play, {TheMistressOfFate} deals each hero {H} psychic damage and {H} melee damage.
When {TheMistressOfFate} flips, each player may move 1 card from their trash to their hand. If any cards were moved this way, destroy this card.
cards.flavorText: “Huh. Deja vu,” mused Vanish.{BR}She turned to find Baccarat staring at{BR}the cat. “That means she changed{BR}something,” he said.

cards.title: Stolen Future
body: Play this card next to the hero with the highest HP. That hero may deal 1 target 5 radiant damage. Then, destroy this card.
When this card is destroyed, destroy all hero characters in its play area.

flavorQuotes.text: What was stolen from me{BR}will be exacted from all.

cards.flavorReference: The Mistress Of Fate, Virtuoso of the Void #60

cards.title: Tangled Weft
body: Each player may discard a card that shares a keyword with at least one of their cards in play.
Then, {TheMistressOfFate} deals each hero that did not discard a card this way 5 infernal damage for each face up Day card.

flavorQuotes.text: Nothing happens that is{BR}not part of my design.

cards.flavorReference: The Mistress Of Fate, The Debt #2

cards.title: To Dust
body: {TheMistressOfFate} deals the hero target with the second highest HP 15 projectile damage.
That hero may shuffle 10 cards from their trash into their deck. If they do, they may redirect that damage to another target.

flavorQuotes.text: Actually, cheaters sometimes{BR}prosper. Just not today.

cards.title: Warped Malus
body: Reduce damage dealt to this card by {H - 2}.
At the end of the villain turn, this card deals each non-villain target {H + 1} energy damage and regains 4 HP.

flavorQuotes.text: Reinforcements from the future.{BR}That gives me an idea.

cards.title: The Timeline
gameplay: Day cards cannot be affected by non-villain cards. Cards beneath villain cards are not considered in play.
Immediately after the environment turn, {TheMistressOfFate} flips if one of these things occurs:

cards.title: Day of Saints
body: When this card flips face up, increase damage dealt by villain targets by 2 until the start of the next villain turn.
Then {TheMistressOfFate} deals the hero with the lowest HP {H * 3} psychic damage.

flavorQuotes.text: Wait, I've been{BR}stuck in a time loop{BR}before? When?

cards.title: Day of Sinners
body: When this card flips face up, put any cards beneath it into play. If there are none, reveal cards from the top of the villain deck until a One-shot is revealed, put it into play, and shuffle the other revealed cards into the villain deck.
When that one-shot leaves play, put it beneath this card.
cards.flavorText: As the 4-day loop repeated,{BR}over and over, time itself began to{BR}splinter and crack.

cards.title: Day of Sorrows
body: When this card flips face up, put any cards beneath it into play. If there are none, reveal cards from the top of the villain deck until an Anomaly is revealed, put it into play, and shuffle the other revealed cards into the villain deck.
When {TheMistressOfFate} flips or that card leaves play, put it beneath this card.

flavorQuotes.text: This is that same rain. They always{BR}show up right after it starts.

cards.title: Day of Swords
body: When this card flips face up, put any cards beneath it into play. If there are none, reveal cards from the top of the villain deck until an Anomaly or One-shot is revealed, put it into play, and shuffle the other revealed cards into the villain deck.
When {TheMistressOfFate} flips or that card leaves play, put it beneath this card.

flavorQuotes.text: I don't think I want to{BR}wish on this one.
